questions.question: Smoking cigarettes ……………………….. injurious to health.
questions.description: Here the subject is the gerund smoking. Gerunds are treated as singular.

questions.question: ……………………… stand there.
questions.description: Imperative sentences are in the simple present tense. Since the subject is you, use a plural verb.

questions.question: ……………………… this file with you.
questions.description: Imperative sentences are in the simple present tense. Since the subject is you, use a plural verb.

questions.question: She ………………………. younger than she actually is.
questions.description: She is a singular subject, so use the verb looks. We use the simple present to talk about people's apperances.

questions.question: There ………………………….. be a tall mango tree in that corner.
questions.description: We use used to to talk about past states. Would cannot be used to express this meaning.

questions.question: She asked me what I …………………………. doing there.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, use a past tense verb in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: She ………………………… in a factory.
questions.description: We normally use the simple present to talk about people's jobs. The present continuous is used to talk about temporary arrangements.

questions.question: We ………………………… hiking yesterday.
questions.description: The simple past is used to say when something happened.

questions.question: I ……………………………. a worse experience than this.
questions.description: The present perfect is more appropriate here.

questions.question: Does anybody ………………………….. who she is?
questions.description: Use the bare infinitive after do, does and did.

questions.question: If I were you, I …………………………….. this.
questions.description: In type 2 conditional, use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + bare infinitive in the main clause.
